column5: A msg from the OFHA    G
It never fails, some people have nothing better to do than to harass others. Id sure hate to be the guy who tells me i cant fish...

I've posted this before, but here it is again:  I always have at least two copies of this on me, in a zip-lock bag. Haven't had to hand one out yet, but if I do, and the person throws it away, I have the second copy to show to the police officer I call:

I've posted this before, but here it is again:  I always have at least two copies of this on me, in a zip-lock bag. Haven't had to hand one out yet, but if I do, and the person throws it away, I have the second copy to show to the police officer I call:  What is the penalty for obstruction here? And who enforces it?
102. (1) A person convicted of an offence under this Act is liable to a fine of not more than $25,000, to imprisonment for a term of not more than one year, or to both.
Good luck getting the charges to stick on that one!!  S

I have had many run ins with Yacht club employees/members telling me that I cant fish in " their marina " I politely tell them that I have every right to fish there and carry on with what I am doing. Once I had a guy ( who I have had run ins with before )screaming at me and  we just acted like we didn't even see or hear him and just kept fishing. He was only ten feet away and his blood was boiling. pretty funny. I also have no problem telling people to take a hike either. Although I have never had to do this, I am prepared. My neighbor is the chief of the T.O. marine unit and I got confirmation from him that they cant kick you out. ( access from a boat )
